Notes: Tuskegee University's Booker T. Washington Collection includes the historical records of the school, as well as other archival and manuscript material on African, African-American, and Caribbean history.  Printed material, still pictures, sound recordings, oral histories, microforms, maps, sheet music, and 2,000 cubic feet of private manuscripts appear in the collectioN  Lynching, race relations, the Southern Conference for Human Welfare-Southern Conference Educational Fund, the Southern Courier, and the National Committee to Abolish the Poll Tax are among the topics documented.  Private papers include those of Booker T. Washington, Robert Sussa Moton, Frederick D. Patterson, Luther Hilton Foster, George Washington Carver, William Levi Dawson, Thomas Monroe Campbell, Monroe Nathan Work, Clinton J. Calloway, Sadid Peterson Delaney, Eugene Heroit Dibble, Isaac Fisher, Lloyd Augustus Hall, William T.B. Williams, and Edith Meriwether Washington Shehee.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
